Administration

Services »
  • Services
  • Administration

  • Police Departmentkeyboard_arrow_right

    • Mission, Values and Beliefs
    • Open Records Request
  • Utilities Departmentkeyboard_arrow_right
    • Pay Utility Bill
    • Utility Confidentiality Request
    • Water Quality Reports

The City Administrator, appointed by the City Council, is the chief operating officer for the City.  The City Administrator is responsible for all City operations, as well as preparing City Council agendas and completing the documentation in support of the Council’s decisions. 

The City Administrator manages budget issues, prioritizes work for City Departments, handles requests for information, and plans for the future of the community.  The position requires cooperation and coordination with residents, business owners, private entities, and other governmental agencies. 

Gary O. Smith, City Administrator
Gary began his career in public service in 1978 when he was hired by the Temple Police Department as a part-time employee.  From that small beginning, he began a 37-year career that ultimately led to being appointed the Chief of Police in 2004.  Gary retired from the City of Temple in 2015 and spent time helping the Belton Police Department with cold case investigations and taught Criminal Justice courses for Temple College.  Following the retirement of Troy’s Police Chief in 2016, Gary returned to full-time public service to become the Police Chief in Troy.  Gary assumed the City Administrator’s duties in April 2021.

Gary is a graduate of Texas A&M University - Central Texas, and holds two Associate Degrees from Temple College. He attended the 166th Session of the FBI National Academy in Quantico, Virginia, as well as numerous executive training courses.  He is a past president of the Central Texas Chiefs of Police and Sheriffs Association, and previously served on the Texas Police Chiefs Association Executive Board, both as an affiliate representative and state liaison for Special Olympics.
